channel.title: [HELP] Java Problems [HELP]
channel.description:
I'm having huge problems with java, I need java to be the 64-Bit version. When i download 64-Bit versions i get an error such as the following image underneath, I need help how to download it so i can run my server. I'm not sure how i can get my compiler to work and stuff.
[center][img]http://i51.tinypic.com/9ar03p.jpg[/img][/center]
When i download java from the java website when it says "Click here for newest java" or whatever. It's the 32-Bit version so when it doesn't work. Can i please have help. Team viewer is also a good idea.
Also I'm not when i download the java just when you go to the java page it saves in the [b]C:\Program Files (x86)[/b] folder.
[center][IMG]http://i52.tinypic.com/23hvdpd.png[/img][/center]
Thanks Guys.

item.title: [HELP] Java Problems [HELP]
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

You need and have to use a 32 bit JDK/.

Read full topic

item.title: [HELP] Java Problems [HELP]
item.dc:creator: @Jeremyramp Jeremyramp
item.description:
@Jeremyramp wrote:

Your proably running a 32bit version of java. Its no problem, Because I run A 64bit windows 7, But i installed Java 32bit version and JDK for 32bit.

Other than that, I used to have a problem installing java, But my problem was that I had bad RAM memory, Sure chance if you bought it from a store, you wouldn’t have that problem…But I highly doublt that would be the problem of yours.

Read full topic
